category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: D43 Consumers’ and Operators’ Acceptance of bioLNG
result.description: Written report on consumers and operators acceptance of bioLNG. It reports the acceptance of bioLNG by consumers and operators of LNG vessels and trucks in cargo and passenger transport based on interviews and a survey conducted by UGRAZ. The report will in particular identify fears and attitudes that might prevent potential applicants to widely establish bioLNG transportation but also motivations that will foster it.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Communication materials pack including multimedia content
result.description: Project identity logo templates for reports generic presentations will be developed and distributed to create brand identity Project social media accounts eg Facebook LinkedIn YouTube will be created and managed Partners will use their institutional social media accounts to disseminate project resultsoutcomes Press releases to showcase the project concept methods and results will be produced at the beginning during and at the end of the project Multimedia content including project videos and images will be created by YOVA and made available to the consortium through internal communication and management platformA range of Trade shows and conferences will be used to publicise the project Presentations at conferences will accelerate the knowledge exchange and dissemination of results with local SMEs Partners will use events to promote networking with commercial and scientific community as well as cooperating on and promoting activities related to other RD activities

result.title: Report on the databases and variables to be collected including a section on the foreseen technical structure and methodologies to consistently downscale
result.description: This report will be developed in Task 3.1 and will consist of a review of existing national and sub-national frameworks and publications for funding measures with the objective to compile and describe a list of existing databases at EU, Norwegian and Swiss level and to identify and describe the policy measures and positions (TI supported by all partners listed above). The report will contain the outcomes of a questionnaire to the consortium partners to collect their data needs for ex-post and ex-ante assessments of LUM drivers and policies in WP4 & WP8. In addition, the report will provide and develop the technical concept of how the data, metadata and interfaces will operate and identify the measures and cases, where estimation approaches are needed to harmonise and/or downscale policy information in T3.2-T3.3.

project.title: LAnd use and MAnagement modelling for SUStainable governance

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
